About

About

Hello! My name is Yibai Meng 孟逸白. I am a undergraduate student of Peking University, majoring in electrical engineering. I enjoy physics and computering science, especially tinkering with Linux.

I started this blog in October, 2017, as a place to document my technical studies. When I do some interesting stuff, I’ll put it up here. Some time I’ll write in Chinese, other times in English. Writing Markdown in Chinese is a hell of a nusiance, as I have to switch language mode a lot to input all these control sequences, so I’ll only write in Chinese when in a good mood. Hope you’ll find my notes interesting!

Write to me if you find anything wrong with my writings. My email is mengyibai@pku.edu.cn. Or make a pull request, if you are a bit more impatient.

This blog is created using Jekyll, a framework for quickly creating static websites. It’s hosted on GitHub pages, a free hosting service(by GitHub of course). I edit my posts in Markdown, using Atom, another open source software by GitHub, on my XiaoMi laptop. It’s powered by electricity, provided by States Gird, generated on a powerplant somewhere in Hebei, China. Meanwhile, I am powered by food provided by PKU cantering service, with rice grown in the Northeast provinces, soy beans in Argentina, milk from New Zealand—wait, I’ve gotten too far, haven’t I?
